characters: SCENES 141 AND 142 INCORPORATED IN SCENES 134 AND 135

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dense forest on a dark, misty night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG EDWARD CARNBY (age 10), small, thin, and terrified, runs for his life. 2 The forest is pitch black. Young Edward ducks between tre under branches, not stopping for anything, GASPING for breath. He doesn't turn to look behind him. He just runs fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomething chases Young Edward through the dark forest. It P.O.V. is skewed, inhuman. It is gaining on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Young Edward runs, beams of light become visible throu the closely packed trees. Something is up ahead, somethin bright. Edward runs towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Edward bursts out into a clearing in the woods, run towards the bright light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light stops whatever is chasing Young Edward at the e of the forest. What is making the light isn't visible, on Young Edward's silhouette running towards the blinding li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beams of a dozen flashlights cut through the mist of dark forest. A dozen uniformed DEPUTIES move through the forest, shini their flashlights around, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees tower over them. A low fog hangs in the air. Th flashlight beams can barely penetrate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large and stately old house stands on the edge of town. small, dense forest stretches out behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign on the front reads: OUR LADY OF PERPETUAL LIGHT ORPHANAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several patrol cars are parked along the Orphanage's grav driveway. DEPUTIES mill around the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another patrol car pulls up. Out of it steps the SHERIFF (late 40s). DEPUTY ADAMS (mid-30s) approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Adams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty kids live at this orphanage, Sheriff. All twenty have gone missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISTER CLARA (mid-40s), an anxious-looking nun, stands on front porch, wrapped in a shawl. She speaks with two DEPUTIES. The Sheriff walks up and listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the power went out, I went to check on the children. But their beds were empty. Every one of them. They just disappeared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 The Deputies sweep through the forest with their flashlig The trees are close together, blocking out the moonlight. thick mist hangs in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Deputy Adams moves through the forest, he sees a brigh light streaming through the trees up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: 3A
dialogues.text: Deputy Adams comes through the trees and emerges into a clearing in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a Shed in the clearing up ahead. A bright light i posted over the Shed's front entrance. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Adams shines his flashlight around the outside of Shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees that the door is open just a crack. On the door i sign marked: DANGER, along with the symbol for ELECTRICIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 Deputy Adams enters the Shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shed is small, packed with electrical equipment, powe cables, and various implements for repairing power lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Adams sweeps through the Shed with his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches a large transformer module that sits at the back of the Shed. It HUMS and CRACKLES with electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a LOW SHUFFLING sound. Deputy Adams stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carefully peers around behind the transformer. The spa is too small for a full-size person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sitting on the ground behind the transformer is Young Edward. He clutches himself, shivering, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 The Sheriff stands with his Deputies. His walkie-talkie CRACKLES to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff! I found one! White, male, about ten years old. Looks to be unharmed. He's in a utility shed maybe half a mile from the orphanage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 Deputy Adams approaches Young Edward. He takes off his ja and wraps it around Young Edward's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Edward pulls the jacket around him and smiles, stil scared, but happy to see the Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, son? Are the other kids around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I don't remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we start with your name? Do you remember your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward... Edward Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDWARD CARNBY (early 30s), lean and intense, wakes up. He quickly looks around to get his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in a large commercial airplane. The compartment i full of seated PASSENGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMALL BOY (age 8) sits next to Carnby, looking up at him. The Small Boy's MOTHER (early 40s) sleeps next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a nightmare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks at the Small Boy, curious. He doesn't respon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ate cheese with dinner. My mommy says cheese gives you nightmares. Want to see my coloring book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Small Boy has a Halloween-themed coloring book open o his lap. It's a graveyard scene, full of cartoon drawings ghosts, werewolves, and vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's a vampire living in my closet, but my mommy says vampires and ghosts aren't real. She says there's nothing to be afraid of in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby weighs what he's going to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother is wrong. Being afraid of the dark is what keeps most of us alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Small Boy's eyes open wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody else tells me not to be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because they don't know the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 Carnby exits the Terminal and heads over to a row of taxi waiting outside the Terminal. He doesn't carry a suitcase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, maybe you're thinking I'm an asshole, trying to scare this poor kid for no reason. But that's where you're wrong. Because I've got my reasons. There's a world around you that you've trained yourself not to see. You've willfully closed your eyes. But your fear of the dark is not a weakness. It's there to protect you from things you'd better pray you never see. My eyes were forced open a long time ago. Now I know. Just because you can't see something, doesn't mean it can't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby steps into the first taxi waiting in the row. The shifts into gear and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another taxi is parked up ahead. As Carnby's taxi passes the second taxi pulls out and follows it.

dialogues.speaker: 13A
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel of the taxi sits JAMES PINKERTON (early 50s). His face is drawn, grim. He wears dark sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER lies dead in the backseat of Pinkerton's taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby's taxi can be seen through the front windshield, driving up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: 13B
dialogues.text: The two taxis drive through traffic. Pinkerton's taxi lag few cars back, but matches Carnby's taxi move for move.

dialogues.speaker: 13C
dialogues.text: The CABBIE (late 20s), manic bordering on crazy, steers through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby rides in the backseat. He looks out the back windshield. A few cars back, Pinkerton's taxi follows the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby takes a burlap sack out of his trench-coat pocket. Inside the sack is a stone carving of a demonic-looking h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The edges are soft, worn-down, the detail roughed away. B it is clearly not a human face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby puts the carving back in his trench-coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You travel light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I'm carrying enough baggage for the both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cabbie CHUCKLES as he steers through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty funny, man. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. Hearing about my passengers' lives keeps the job interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a paranormal investigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an effective solution to unusual problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby turns to look out the back windshield. Pinkerton's taxi is still following from a few cars back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, that taxi's been following us since the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit? Want me to lose him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cabbie GUNS the motor and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby's taxi accelerates down the street, pulling away f Pinkerton's taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as it's evident that they are on to him, Pinkerto taxi speeds up to give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two taxis rocket down the streets, swerving past cars SCREECHING around corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby's taxi speeds down the streets, narrowly avoiding collisions with other cars and PEDESTRIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton just plows through whatever's in his way, SMASH past other cars, forcing Pedestrians to jump out of the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton accelerates and tries to force Carnby's taxi of the road. The taxi's GRIND against one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby's taxi SCREECHES around a corner, speeding into a street that leads to the Market Street.

dialogues.speaker: 13D
dialogues.text: A busy street crowded with PEDESTRIANS, open shops, and produce stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby's taxi races down the busy Market Street, followed Pinkerton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They swerve and SCREECH down the Street, cutting off othe cars, and narrowly avoiding Pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Pinkerton's taxi ZOOMS up beside Carnby's taxi a BUMPS into it with a GRINDING CRUSH of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not stopping, Pinkerton's taxi continues to GRIND into Carnby's taxi. The momentum pushes Carnby's taxi around sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton's taxi then SLAMS Carnby's sideways taxi into a parked car with a CRUSH of metal and SHATTERING glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a moment as Carnby, trapped inside the CRUSHED ta and Pinkerton, flooring the accelerator to add more press exchange a look. Pinkerton's expression is fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton gears the taxi into reverse, backing up in orde smash into Carnby's taxi again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cabbie is trapped by the crushed front of the taxi. H face is covered with a spiderweb of deep cuts. The Cabbie struggles to get loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trapped, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll draw him away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pinkerton's taxi backs up, it CRASHES into a Van drivi by, knocking it over onto its side and spilling the conte of the Van onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gives Carnby the brief moment he needs to extract himself from the crushed taxi. He wrenches himself out th window, just in time to see Pinkerton's taxi accelerating towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby bolts away from the crushed taxi and the trapped Cabbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton immediately swerves his taxi, aiming it right f the running Carnby. Pinkerton's taxi rockets towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby leaps out of the way as Pinkerton's taxi CRASHES i the side of a Building, narrowly missing him. Pinkerton's taxi is CRUMPLED in a CRASH of metal and glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby narrowly avoids being crushed between the taxi and building. With fluid grace, Carnby rolls to safety, landi on his feet. With a quick look back over his shoulder at Pinkerton in his crumpled taxi, Carnby runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton steps out of his taxi, seemingly unhurt by the crash. He looks around, but can't see Carnby anywhere on street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton runs for an iron-wrought staircase that leads u a Pedestrian Bridge that hangs over the Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the Pedestrian Bridge, Pinkerton looks up a down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots Carnby, running through the crowd of Pedestrians

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton leaps off the Pedestrian Bridge, arcing through air with superhuman force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton TACKLES the running Carnby to the ground, SLAMM into him with a tremendous impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Carnby is quick. He takes the hit and spins Pinkerton around with a martial-arts kick. The kick sends Pinkerton CRASHING through the front window of a Bakery.

dialogues.speaker: 13E
dialogues.text: Pinkerton comes CRASHING through the display window, land in a pile of sticky buns and broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But seemingly unfazed, he just picks himself up and walks back out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: 13F
dialogues.text: Carnby stands in a crowd of BYSTANDERS, watching in surpr as Pinkerton exits the Bakery, his expression fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton immediately spots Carnby and comes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby bolts away, running into a Herbalist Store across street.

dialogues.speaker: 13G
dialogues.text: Jars of different shapes and sizes containing a variety o medicinal herbs and other such substances are on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby runs into the Herbalist Store, making his way thro the displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton leaps right through the Herbalist Store's front display window in a hail of SHATTERED glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tackles Carnby, CRASHING through the jars on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton SLAMS Carnby to the ground. He grabs Carnby's h and SMASHES it against the floor once, then twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton tears open Carnby's trench-coat. He pulls out t burlap sack. He opens the sack, confirming the stone carv is inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Pinkerton inspects the stone carving, Carnby's hand quietly moves to a large glass jar lying next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby SMASHES the glass jar over Pinkerton's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the stone carving out of Pinkerton's hand, scram to his feet, and runs.

dialogues.speaker: 13H
dialogues.text: Carnby BURSTS out of the Herbalist Store's back door, exi out into a small, cluttered Alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby lands hard in the debris, but he rolls with the fa and is back up on his feet, running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alley ends in a high Wall with a Billboard on top of The Wall has a railing along one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby vaults over the railing and keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alley is crowded with WORKERS unloading crates out of loading dock of the Ice Factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAT COP walks by. Carnby runs past the Beat Cop, just barely bumping into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as Carnby passes him, he deftly grabs the Beat Cop's from his holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beat Cop doesn't even notice his gun is missing as he turns, annoyed to see Carnby racing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton runs out of the Herbalist Store's back door. He runs directly at the high Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton leaps up, scrambling right up the side of the W He hauls himself up the Billboard, until he's standing at top of the Billboard itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton looks down below and spots Carnby running into loading dock of the Ice Factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton leaps off the Billboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beat Cop looks up, stunned to see Pinkerton leaping towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton lands on top of a moving dolly of crates, CRUSH the crates on it. The WORKER pushing the dolly falls back shocked. Pinkerton leaps off the dolly and keeps chasing after Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beat Cop fumbles for his gun. It's not there. Pinkert smashes the Beat Cop out of the way as he pursues Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beat Cop flies into a pile of crates, knocked out. Pinkerton follows Carnby into the Ice Factory.

dialogues.speaker: 13J
dialogues.text: The refrigerated Ice Factory is filled with neat rows of blocks. FACTORY WORKERS mill about, transporting the bloc of ice through the Factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby hides between the rows of ice blocks. He checks th Beat Cop's gun to make sure it's loaded. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby stops, sensing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one fluid motion, Carnby suddenly spins, turning in th other direction and FIRING the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the bullet as it rockets through the Ice Factor It WHIZZES along, until we see Carnby's intended target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton comes through the Ice Factory, running at Carnb The bullet flies directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet hits Pinkerton in the shoulder. But it only se to anger Pinkerton further. He keeps running at Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton leaps at Carnby. Carnby FIRES again. But Pinker dodges the bullet and it hits a block of ice, SHATTERING in a hail of ice shards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton rolls with his dodge and races off into the sta of ice blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby tries to track Pinkerton's movements through the i stacks. He hears the sound of Pinkerton MOVING, but can't him. His gun is ready. He searches around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's a RUSH of movement behind him. Carnby dodges just as Pinkerton's fist comes flying out. Pinkert connects with an ice block, SHATTERING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby is backed into a dead end in the Ice Factory. He t to face Pinkerton, gun ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Pinkerton is on him too quickly. He lunges at Carnby, hoisting him over his head and SLAMMING him down on a conveyer belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton drags Carnby along the conveyer belt. But Carnb grabs a hanging chain to steady himself. With a quick kic Carnby uses the momentum to flip Pinkerton over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton flies through the air towards a large ice pick wedged into the wall. The sharp point of the ice pick pun right through Pinkerton's torso, impaling him. He is immediately killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby leans up against the wall, steadying himself. He p the stone carving out of his pocket to check it. In the fight, the carving has been cracked into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the broken carving reveals something hidden inside it small gold artifact that was concealed in the carving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The artifact is a gold circle, flat on the top and bottom its thick round side engraved with intricate Abkani symbo This is the lynchpin artifact, the piece which connects t other artifacts together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 The elegant Museum of Natural History. A wide staircase l up to an entranceway surrounded by stone pillars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the front of the Museum hangs a large banner reading "SECRETS OF THE ANCIENT ABKANI В­ COMING SOON".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 The high-ceilinged Main Hall of the Museum. Glass display cases are set up to showcase archeological artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALINE CEDRAC (late 20s), studious but dynamic, stands in front of a display case. She carries a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy-set GUARD (early 50s) approaches, followed by a DELIVERY GUY (late 20s), who hauls in a crate on a dolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got another delivery, Ms. Cedrac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline checks her clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything scheduled. What museum was it transferred from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delivery Guy reads the information on his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Dr. Hudgens, from Dr. Hudgens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably an error. It must be for the big Abkani show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abkani? What the hell's Abkani?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient Native American civilization. They were this super-advanced culture, but something like ten thousand years ago, they just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been reading up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much else to do around here at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline picks up a crowbar and approaches the crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here it's not to be opened by anyone but Dr. Hudgens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Aline Cedrac. She's the assistant curator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got Abkani artifacts coming in from museums around the world. Until Hudgens gets back, I'm doing all the cataloguing anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline pries open the lid of the crate with the crow-bar. of the packing foam, Aline lifts up a heavy stone tablet carved with elaborate Abkani symbols. Aline holds it up, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Hudgens anyway? The show opens in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off on another archeological goosechase. He thinks he's finally found the Erebus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he sticks you with the work. At least it keeps your mind off your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline pleasant expression suddenly turns awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my office if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline quickly walks off, taking the stone tablet with her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it... I shouldn't have said that. Her boyfriend's been missing for the last three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery Guy shakes his head at the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice going, jack-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 A large Ship out on the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREWMEN scurry around the deck attending to a huge crane hangs over the side of the Ship. Chains leads from the cr into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LIONEL HUDGENS (mid-60s), wiry and severe with a shar intelligence, stands on the deck with CAPTAIN CHERNICK (l 40s). They look down at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say a sunken ship is like a grave. It should never be disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been searching for the Erebus for twenty years, Captain. Now that I've found it, I'm afraid your ill-informed superstitions aren't enough to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 Two DIVERS in high-tech Newt Suits break the surface. The signal to Captain Chernick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Hudgens nods to Captain Chernick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick signals to his Crewmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crane is engaged. The chains run through the mechanis the crane, pulling something to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crane GROANS under the weight. Captain Chernick looks nervous as the crane SHUDDERS with the strain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 Out of the ocean, the crane raises a large, heavy contain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The container is about eight feet long. It is battered an damaged by the ocean water, and covered in barnacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 Carnby unlocks the multiple locks on the front door to hi Loft and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carnby walks through the Loft, he passes his answering machine. The MESSAGES indicator blinks. Carnby presses th button to retrieve his messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, John here. Hope things went well wherever you were this time. And, please, do not, I repeat, do not tell me about it. Every time you tell me about your latest case, I get nightmares for a week. Anyway, give me a call when you get back. Linda wants to have you by for dinner. Lord knows why, but she seems to like you. And if you haven't scared Aline away yet, bring her along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loft is a large, incredibly cool-looking space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one corner is a lab area filled with high-tech scienti equipment. At another work station, dozens of drawings, m and photos are spread out next to a flat-screen computer. few photos are tacked to a corkboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several bookshelves, all crammed with books, line one wal old framed photograph sits on a bookshelf, a faded photo twenty CHILDREN sitting on the front steps of the Orphana Sister Clara stands with them. Young Edward sits to one s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weapons cabinet features racks lined with guns and blad weapons. In another corner is a work-out area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleek, modern kitchen and living quarters are in anot corner. The bed is set up against a wall of large windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the windows, the sun is setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the lab area, Carnby takes out the lynchpin artifact. He turns it around in his fingers, watching the light glint off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 The Ship is docked at a mist-enshrouded pier. Overhead li along the dock illuminate the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transport truck is parked on the Dock just next to the Ship's loading ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the ramp, five CREWMEN with automatic weapons stand guard, smoking and looking vigilant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 Standing on the Ship's wide deck, Captain Chernick looks impatient. Hudgens stands over the large, barnacle-covere container. The container is secured with a heavy rusted l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two large, muscular men, the FIRST MATE and CREWMAN BARNE check the chains connecting the container to the huge cra on the deck. They are preparing to load it onto the truck the Dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to open it? Make sure it's what you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conditions must be perfect. Otherwise, there will be... consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick steps up to the barnacle-covered contain He notices that a section of the barnacles have gotten scraped off in the transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the barnacles, the container is revealed to made of gold. Chernick look startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick rubs the gold spot on the container and looks closely at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this made of solid gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the Abkani were the first civilization to use gold for their valuables? They believed it held the power to contain evil spirits. Thousands of years later, we don't even remember why gold was valuable to us in the first place. Now, let's load it onto the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick exchanges a look with the First Mate and Crewman Barnes. They both give him a subtle nod.

dialogues.speaker: 26A
dialogues.text: Carnby sits in his lab area, studying the lynchpin artifa under an illuminated magnifying lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer runs an analysis of the symbols carved into artifact. The symbols flash by. The computer BEEPS, ready has isolated the origins of the symbols. They are ABKANI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks over at a photo tacked to the corkboard next the work station. The photo is of Carnby and Aline.

dialogues.speaker: 26B
dialogues.text: The Office is cluttered with books, maps, diagrams, and strange artifacts. Along one wall are several ceiling-hig shelving units, each containing rows of drawers. The draw hold artifacts from the Museum's collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline inspects the stone tablet. She speaks into a tape recorder, like a coroner recording an autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictograms are late-period Abkani. It seems to be some sort of... prophecy. Shadows that make ghosts of men. The world of light consumed by darkness. This is the first indication I've ever seen that the Abkani had a myth about the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: 26C
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick approaches Hudgens at the container. The First Mate and Crewman Barnes stand quietly behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the container's made of gold, whatever's inside must be worth a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chernick pulls out a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm looking forward to finding out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chernick smacks Hudgens across the face with his pistol. Hudgens gives Chernick a grim look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose one should not be surprised when mercenaries act mercenary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rewman Barnes grabs Hudgens and twists his arms behind hi back, incapacitating him. The First Mate pulls out a revo and points it right at Hudgens' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick wedges a crowbar into the container's lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a terrible mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only mistake would be letting you walk out with whatever's in there. Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crewman Barnes SMASHES Hudgens' head against the containe Hudgens is dazed from the blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw him in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crewman Barnes throws the dazed Hudgens into a Storage Ro built onto the Deck. He slams the thick metal door closed The door has a small, glass-covered peephole built into i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chernick pries open the lock with the crowbar. Chernick h the First Mate the crowbar and he jams it into the handle the door, wedging it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 Hudgens struggles to his feet. He BANGS on the door, tryi to pull it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain! Don't open it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 The First Mate and Crewman Barnes watch in fasciation as Captain Chernick prepares to open the gold container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what all the fuss is about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a deep SIGH, the vacuum of dry air escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 Carnby sits in front of his computer. He scans through screens of information relating to Abkani civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby suddenly winces in intense pain. He clutches his h staggering to his feet. He knocks over a desk lamp and a chair as he stumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing his head and trying to shake off the pain, Carnb collapses unconscious to the floor. He is out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the work station, the lynchpin artifact starts to glow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 JOHN HOUGHTON (early 30s) lies asleep in his bed next to wife, LINDA HOUGHTON (early 30s).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, John opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John quietly sits up and gets out of bed. Linda is woken but just barely. John walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda rolls over and falls back asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 John exits the house. He walks down the front path and ou into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 Carnby lies unconscious on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lynchpin artifact glows brightly, emitting a LOW HUM. 3

dialogues.speaker: 2A
dialogues.text: A low wind wafts through the Main Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air flows through the space, swirling dust along the floo banner hanging from the ceiling ripples from the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 Aline sits at her desk, her back to the shelving units. S inspects the stone tablet and takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the shelving units, a faint glow emanates out o closed drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in another drawer begins glowing. Then the cont of a third drawer start to glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the three drawers, a LOW HUM is emitted. Aline loo up, tilting her head to hear the LOW HUMMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around to face the shelving units. She is surpr to see the strange glow coming out of the three drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cautiously approaches the shelving units. She reaches hand out to open the first glowing drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 As the First Mate and Crewman Barnes watch in anticipatio Captain Chernick opens the gold container all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The container is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights along the Deck start to flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 The lights in the Storage Room start to flicker on and of Hudgens looks up at the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're faster than I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 he lights continue to flicker. Captain Chernick turns to Storage Room door. He looks back at the First Mate and Crewman Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Mate and Crewman Barnes pull out revolvers. The approach the Storage Room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a WHOOSH of movement behind them. The three men a turn, surprised. But nothing is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Captain Chernick is thrown back by something invisible. He is hoisted into the air. He looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick seems to be floating just above the grou although it is clear something invisible is holding him u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Mate and Crewman Barnes look on, stunned, their revolvers aimed at the floating Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick's body contorts, as if something had bee thrust into it. With a burst of blood, a hole is ripped i his torso, killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Chernick's lifeless body is dropped to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, the First Mate and Crewman Barnes aim their 4    revolvers at the empty air. They OPEN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 Hudgens stands at the door, listening to the GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through the peephole in the door. The peephole i dirty, hard to see through. Something frantic is happenin outside the door, but it's hard to see exactly what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more GUNFIRE and then SCREAMING. Short BURSTS of AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE follow, and more SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, all is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens grabs a discarded metal rod and jams it into the handle, wedging it closed. He backs away from the door. T only weapon he can see is a box-cutter. He grabs it, hold it out in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's a CRASH at the door. Something pushes a the door, trying to get in. The door RATTLES and THUMPS f the impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens, still holding the box-cutter, strains against th door, using all the effort he can muster to keep it shut. metal rod wedged against the door is starting to buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door is still. Hudgens waits. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a CRASH as another impact hits the door. The RACK is even more intense. But the door holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the thrashing stops. All is quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the Storage Room stop flickering. They come back on. Hudgens listens, straining to hear anything at a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautious, Hudgens pulls away the metal rod. He gingerly touches the door. With a long CREAK, it slowly swings ope The crowbar was shaken loose from all the impacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens steps out of the Storage Room. He looks around th Deck. Mist blows in off the water. The night is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies lie everywhere, Captain Chernick, the First Mate, Crewman Barnes, the other Crewmen. Their weapons lie next their slashed, ripped open bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullet holes are pocked around the Deck. Streaks of blood smeared everywhere. Shell casings and corpses are all tha remain of the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense, carefully looking around, Hudgens walks up to the empty gold container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into it, pressing a concealed panel at the bac the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panel opens, revealing a small artifact. The artifact a thin hollow cylinder with a thick little protrusion on end. It is covered in Abkani symbols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens takes out the artifact. He turns it around in his hand. He looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 Everything in Bureau 713's Headquarters looks sleek and h tech. There are no windows anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMMANDER BURKE (late 30s) strides purposefully down the hallway. He is confident to the point of arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His second-in-command, AGENT MILES (mid-30s), driven and efficient, hurries to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his better be good, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're getting some strange readings in the control room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his is Bureau 713. "Strange" doesn't even crack my radar. Now what's the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, normal levels of paranormal activity range from three to five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: condescending) Yes Miles. And what level are the sensors picking up now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke and Miles arrive at the Control Room. Burke nods to BUREAU GUARDS standing at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke stops and looks at Agent Miles for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They only go up to 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles opens the door to the Control Room. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 Inside the Control Room, the banks of monitors and sensor are all lit up. Streams of data flow across the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke and Miles stand at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT "KRASH" KRASHINSKY (mid-30s), a cool and collected female tech-geek, scans through data on the monitors. She always wears a headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we looking at, Krashinsky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electromagnetics off the scale, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT YONEK, a Control Room techie, adjusts the sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recalibrating sensors now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke looks concerned for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 Young Edward (age 10) walks through the Den. The lights a all out. The Den is musty, but clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sliver of light glows from underneath the doorway to Si Clara's bedroom. Young Edward KNOCKS softly on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara opens the door. She wears her nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still having trouble sleeping, Edward? You can't stay up all night, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister, something's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Edward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not gone anymore. The others are back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 Sister Clara throws open the door to one of the children' bedrooms. Ten beds are lined up along the wall. All ten o them have CHILDREN asleep in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara GASPS, holding her hand to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Carnby lurches awake. He is still lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cellphone is RINGING. Carnby gets to his feet, rubbin his temples, trying to get his bearings. He answers his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, thank god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) It's John. I woke up and... he's just gone. All his clothes are here. His car's in the garage. It's like he just got up in the middle of the night and walked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 Linda stands on the Front Porch, her eyes red from crying Carnby is just leaving. He holds some recent photos of Jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll figure this out, Linda. I'll find John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby moves to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward... you've known each other since you were kids. Did he... did he tell you he was leaving me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is he, Edward? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: 57A
dialogues.text: The Orphanage looks much the same after twenty years. It slightly more worn-down, but still well-maintained.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: arnby drives up the gravel driveway in his black SUV. He pulls to a stop behind an old, battered yellow School Bus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a window on the ground floor, SISTER CLARA (now mid- watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few CHILDREN play on the Orphanage's front lawn. They a look over at Carnby, curious, eager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby exits his SUV. He looks around at the Orphanage grounds as he walks up the front steps. He smiles at the Children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara opens the front door. SOPHIE (age 13) stands with her, eyeing Carnby suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I make some tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you, Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie sneaks a look back at Carnby as she enters the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara approaches Carnby, smiling warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get a look at you. Are you sleeping enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister... John disappeared last night. And something happened to me as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara's expression drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GIRL (age 8) runs up to them. She hides behind Si Clara, staring up at Carnby, curious, a little scared. Ca smiles at the Young Girl and she ducks behind Sister Clar But then she sticks her face out to watch him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Sister. I need to find the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get their files.

dialogues.speaker: 57C
dialogues.text: Carnby is on the phone, sitting in front of his computer. While he speaks, he reads information on the FEDERAL MISS PERSON DATABASE. The computer processes information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you know as soon as I hear something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby has a list of nineteen names, the grown-up ORPHANS from his Orphanage. Next to each name, Carnby has written note. Fourteen are missing. Five are unaccounted for so f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby writes a note next to the second-to-last name on t list. Also missing. Four now unaccounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the work station is a stack of the Orphanage's worn-ou old file folders. Each file matches a name on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The database finishes processing. It has found a match. A MISSING PERSON REPORT flashes onscreen. It's the final na of the list. Carnby makes a note next to the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby hits PRINT and the report comes out of the printer adds it to a small stack of similar reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each report has a photo of a missing Orphan, both MALE an FEMALE. One of the photos is of John Houghton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen are missing. Three are unaccounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 The outdoor patio of a downtown Restaurant. Carnby sits w a coffee and a cherry pie at a table for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT PAUL FISCHER (mid-50s), precise but friendly, approaches the table and sits down across from Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I agree to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER walks up. He puts down a plate of pecan pie in f of Fischer. The Waiter smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ordered for you, Fischer. It's pecan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer gives Carnby a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a good memory, Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer takes a bite of the pecan pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer pulls out a file and slides it across the table. Carnby opens the file. Inside it are photos and reports o the three remaining Orphans from Carnby's list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tracked down the three you asked about. They all disappeared last night. Same story. No suitcase. No car. Just up and walked out in the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means all nineteen are missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran full cross-references. Nothing much in common between them. Except they all grew up in the same orphanage. Your orphanage. What's going on, Carnby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby gets up to leave. He picks up the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Fischer. It's good to know I've still got friends at 713.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 As the sun sets, the streetlights around the Museum all c on in unison, bathing the area in a warm glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are all on in the Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 Aline sits at her desk, notes spread out in front of her. notes show various Abkani symbols. She writes down commen in the margins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Aline answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did a shipment arrive for me today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fascinating piece, Dr. Hudgens. I started decoding the pictograms and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Who told you to do that? That crate was not to be opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only going to catalogue it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your place to question my instructions, Ms. Cedrac. Leave the tablet alone. I'll catalogue it myself when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Dr. Hudgens, I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hudgens has already hung up. Aline looks at the recei frustrated. She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, tilting her head to hear FOOTSTEPS approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard KNOCKS on the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's... somebody here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 Aline exits quickly out of a service door, looking anxiou The Guard scurries after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby stands in front of the Security Desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline runs up and embraces Carnby. She holds him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline lets go. They hold eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Aline rears back and PUNCHES Carnby in the face. Ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby takes the hit, rubbing his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead, you asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline... let me explain. In private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks over at the Guard. The Guard pretends to rea his newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one reason why I'd ever want to speak to you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby reaches into his pocket and takes out the lynchpin artifact. Aline stares down at it, immediately fascinated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Abkani...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes, Aline. I'll tell you everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 Carnby stands with Aline at her desk, while she scans a 3 rendering of the lynchpin artifact into her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the Amazon for six weeks, tracking poachers through their transport lines. Then I fell in with a group of ex- Chilean military selling artifacts on the black-market. This was found in a gold mine in the southern tip of Chile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did you end up with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked very nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Aline looks up at Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've called, Edward. Or written. Just to let me know you were alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline picks up the lynchpin artifact, inspecting it. She her fingers over the Abkani symbols carved into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it make any sense to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday, maybe not. But something happened last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline and Carnby stand at a work station. A piece of clot covers up something on the work station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: line pulls back the cloth, revealing three Abkani artifac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of the three artifacts is a gold ring, one small and thin, one medium and slightly thicker, and one large. The large ring is shaped like a pyramid with the top cut off has thin protrusions on its base. Each of the ring artifa is well-worn from age and engraved with Abkani symbols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline puts the lynchpin artifact down next to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were found in completely different locations. Alaska. Newfoundland. Venezuela. And now this one's from Chile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand years ago, it would've been like burying them at the ends of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline picks up the lynchpin artifact again. She runs her fingers over one symbol in particular, carved into the fl top of the artifact: the DARK SPIRIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abkani's written language is based on pictograms. Combinations of symbols to create different meanings. But there's one here I've never seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he lights in the Office start to flicker. In unison, the computer monitors all go dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby pulls out a flashlight and flicks it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not trying to seduce me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline grabs Carnby's flashlight. She lights their way to Office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 The lights flicker. Large shadows are cast through the ar by the remaining, dim lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard sits at the Security Desk, talking on the phone The security monitors are all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if nothing's wrong with the grid. Something's definitely wrong with our power. Get someone down here, pronto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a WHOOSH of movement behind him. The Guard turns the sound. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks on his flashlight, shining the beam into the da corners of the area. Nothing is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something CLATTERS in another room. The Guard quickly tur to the sound of the movement.

dialogues.speaker: 65A
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline walk down the Hallway. Framed art hangs the walls. Small sculptures sit on pedestals along the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overhead lights in the Hallway emit only a low glow, flickering sporadically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline leads the way with a flashlight. They come up to a to a second Hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hairs on the back of Carnby's neck rise up. He touche the back of his neck, spooked. Aline notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hairs on the back of my neck just stood up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby pulls out his PARA-METER. It's an old, battered device. The display lights up as Carnby turns it on. The meter immediately picks up some readings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come every time you show up, my life gets complicated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could ask you the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby listens at the door. Carnby nods to Aline as he op the door. Nothing is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard enters the Ceramics Room. The overhead lights g off only low glows, flickering sporadically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display cases and large sculptures give off long shad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard walks through the room, shining his flashlight around. He can't see anything out of the ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHOOSH of movement slips past the Guard. He turns quick Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines his flashlight around, looking for anything out the ordinary. He stands with his back to a display case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the shadows behind the display case, a long, segmented tail emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail is covered in hard, dark scales. At the end of t tail is a sharp spike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail suddenly flicks at the Guard, piercing him throu the back of the head and out his mouth. The tail's spike glistens with fresh blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard's flashlight CLATTERS to the floor. The bulb BREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail withdraws from the Guard. The Guard's body falls the ground, dead.

dialogues.speaker: 65C
dialogues.text: Aline leads the way with the flashlight, followed by Carn The Hallway is only faintly lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From up ahead, they hear a CLATTERING sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby reaches into his holster and pulls out his revolve Aline hands him the flashlight without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 Aline and Carnby quietly come out a service door that lea to the Ceramics Room. They conceal themselves behind a pa of columns, scanning the area before they step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are dim, with long shadows stretching out thro the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline is about to speak, but Carnby puts a finger to his mouth and shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead body of the Guard lies in a pool of blood on the ground. There seems to be no one else around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, silently, moving with a fluid grace, a XENOMORP CREATURE emerges out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The xenomorph creature is huge, terrifying. It is seven f tall, covered in thick, dark scales. It stands on two leg with long, powerful arms that end in razor-sharp claws an segmented, spiked tail poised behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its demonic head has black, sunken eyes and a severe jaw lined with jagged, fang-like teeth. The head is identical the stone carving in which the lynchpin artifact was enca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline look shocked. They freeze, not moving a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another xenomorph creature steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two creatures congregate in the middle of the room. T are the same hulking, grotesque brutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two creatures start to communicate. An unintelligible language passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, one of the creatures looks up, sensing somethin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature looks directly at Carnby and Aline, hiding behind the columns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature delivers a SHARP WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, the creature fades into invisibility. It h totally disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second creature immediately follows suit, also fading invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'd better run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline scramble to their feet and sprint back towards the service door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An invisible creature comes racing after them. All that i visible is the effect of the creature's movement. It knoc over a statue as it chases after them. The statue SMASHES the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline is through the door. Carnby runs through it and Ali pulls it closed behind them.

dialogues.speaker: 69A
dialogues.text: Aline and Carnby run down the long Hallway, towards a pai double-doors at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service door behind them bursts open. An invisible creature runs down the Hallway towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the invisible creature runs, it knocks framed art off walls, smashes aside tables and chairs. The creature isn' visible, only the effect of its movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby turns and FIRES his gun at the on-rushing creature

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his bullets don't hit anything except the wall on the other side of the Hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby keeps FIRING, still not hitting anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The invisible creature races towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the double-doors at the other end of the Hallwa burst open. The second invisible creature starts running towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both directions down the Hallway are now blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby spots an open door marked STORAGE ROOM. He pushes Aline into it and jumps in after her.

dialogues.speaker: 69B
dialogues.text: Carnby leans up against the door, pushing it closed. Alin fumbles for her building keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a CRASH as the creature SLAMS against the other s of the door. Carnby strains to keep it closed. The door RATTLES as the creature CRASHES into it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline finds the right key. She gets it into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the creature PUNCHES a clawed hand right throug the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand is visible as it digs its claws into Aline's arm The claws cut deep gashes into her. She SCREAMS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impact knocks the key out of the lock. Aline drops th keys as she clutches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature's arm retracts out the hole in the door. It SMASHES into the door even harder, trying to break throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby strains against the door, trying to keep it closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hold it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline grabs her keys. She finds the right key, jams the k in the lock, and turns the bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another CRASH at the door. But the lock holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any way out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Why didn't you ask me that before you pushed me in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another CRASH. Carnby and Aline back away from th door. The door starts to buckle from the impacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby reloads his revolver. He has it ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then the CRASHING stops. Aline and Carnby listen. Everything is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of HELICOPTERS can be faintly heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby listens against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby nods to her. Aline unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby steps out of the Storage Room, revolver ready. The Hallway is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline steps out behind him. She motions to the double-doo at the end of the Hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those doors lead to the front entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby hands Aline the flashlight. He grips his revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline move down the Hallway towards the double doors. As they move, they listen intently. The only thing they can hear is the sound of their FOOTSTEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCENES 69D To 69G OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 Aline and Carnby quietly open the double-doors leading in the Main Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are dim. Moonlight streams in through the skyl above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline shines the flashlight around. She hears a WHOOSH of movement behind her and shines the flashlight towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a quickly approaching HELICOPTER can be hear the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double-doors BURST open as an invisible creature SMAS through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It chases after them, knocking everything in its path out the way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead of them, the second invisible creature comes CRASHING through the display cases, heading right for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline are trapped between the two invisible creatures. They have nowhere to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a HELICOPTER rises up overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, powerful spotlights switch on, shining bright b beams through the skylight. Another set of spotlight beam shine through the high windows lining the Main Hall. 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek black Bureau 713 helicopter hovers over the build A pair of spotlights shine beams down through the skyligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 In a hail of shattered glass, AGENTS BARR (male), CHEUNG (female), and MARKO (male) burst through the skylight, rappelling down on zip-lines from the hovering helicopter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each carry a sleek, high-tech assault rifle with a l mounted on the top. They all wear full Bureau 713 combat gear, body armor with a headset comm-link and a helmet wi dark visor mounted on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures HISS in reaction and scramble out of the spotlights from the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents immediately open FIRE. Their bullets glow with pulse of yellow light as they streak through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Carnby and Aline can see is the Agents shooting glowi bullets into the unnaturally long shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the SQUEAL of one of the creatures shows that the Age bullets have found their target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the glowing bullets hit the creature, it momentarily flashes visible, then invisible again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two invisible creatures scatter, slipping away into t shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents cut their zip-lines, dropping to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they land, they all flip on their rifle-mounted lamps. bright blue beams cut through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their movements are precise, controlled. They all have th rifles out, scanning the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Barr has a high-tech scanning device attached to hi rifle. It is an updated version of Carnby's para-meter th monitors the electromagnetic energy in the vicinity. It i used to detect the presence of the xenomorph creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading two xenos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long shadow slips across the room. Agent Cheung sees it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Cheung opens FIRE. Agents Barr and Marko are immediately at her side, FIRING at the invisible creature Their bullets glow as they streak through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the creature is too fast. The glowing bullets streak through the air, but don't hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Losing readings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheung! Marko! Don't let them get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents Cheung and Marko open FIRE, sending streams of glo bullets across the Main Hall. But they don't hit anything

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Barr scans around with his rifle-mounted para-meter lamp. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline stand back, not wanting to get in the Agents' way, not equipped to really help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dim lights suddenly flicker and come back on at full strength, bathing the debris of the battle in a warm glow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Barr turns his rifle to Carnby and Aline. They stan their ground, facing him. 8

dialogues.speaker: 5A
dialogues.text: Krash reads the data streaming by on her banks of monitor She speaks into her omnipresent headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Readings gone. You lost them, Barr.

dialogues.speaker: 85B
dialogues.text: Agent Barr holds his rifle trained at Carnby and Aline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents Cheung and Marko move through the double-doors int the Hallway sweeping the area with their lamps, making su the creatures are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Krash, I know. Commander Burke, we're secure. And sir... Carnby is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 The lights around the Museum have come back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of Bureau 713 Humvees are parked with large spotli set up in front of them, shining into the Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ommander Burke stands with Agent Miles. They both wear fu combat gear, visors, and headset comm-links. Burke addres five AGENTS in combat gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a full security sweep. Miles, get Fischer to send his sci-and-spy boys down here. Now go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents stream into the Museum in formation. Burke and Miles follow in after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 The silhouettes of the five Agents, Burke, and Miles come through the spotlight beams as they enter the Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke strides up to Carnby and Aline, who stand with Agen Barr. Miles follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hat the hell are you doing here, Carnby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Richie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Commander Burke. This is my unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to be able to take care of yourself, Carnby. Gotten soft since you left 713?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles steps in between Burke and Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Cedrac, I'm Agent Miles. This is Commander Burke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline Cedrac. Pleasure to meet you. How's the Ph.D. coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline looks surprised that Burke knows so much about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke sees Aline's arm is bleeding from the gashes clawed into her by the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles, get her to a medic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline looks over at Carnby. He nods to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles escorts Aline out of the Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke and Carnby regard one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I still looking at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what those things are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That information's classified. If you were still an agent, you'd already know. But since you're not, stay out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke turns to stride away. Carnby grabs his arm. Burke t back, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke grabs Carnby's arm, trying to twist it away. But Carnby's fast enough to slip out of Burke's hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now angry, Burke grabs Carnby by the collar, shoving him against a stone column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Carnby deftly twists out of Burke's grip and shoves h up against the same stone column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the struggle, Carnby's hand flicks into Burke's pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Barr intervenes, pulling Carnby away. Burke straigh himself out, trying not to look rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby shrugs off Agent Barr and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Commander. I guess I have gone soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carnby walks off, he looks down in his hand. He has li Burke's I-D card out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 The front of the Museum has been completely blocked off. There is lots of activity, as BUREAU AGENTS mill around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline sits in the back of a 713 Emergency Medical Vehicle 713 MEDIC finishes dressing the cuts on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby approaches her. Aline nods to the Medic and gets u join Carnby. They speak quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to finish studying those artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find out what's happened to John and the others. Stay in contact. We'll meet up later.

dialogues.speaker: 91A
dialogues.text: Burke oversees a team of AGENTS in biohazard suits as the sweep the scene, running scans of the area on high-tech h held devices. Photos are snapped by another AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles escorts Aline over to Burke. Burke is distrac by the scanning device he is holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, I need to get to my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum's quarantined until we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
