dialogues.text: gent Miles OPENS FIRE, sending a stream of glowing bullet at the approaching creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE rings out all around. Glowing bullets streak thro the dark night in all directions. Nearby, an Agent SCREAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 713 defenses have become chaotic, uncontrolled. Glowi bullets fly everywhere. The SQUEALS of injured creatures mingle with the SCREAMS of dying Agents. The constant RAT of automatic GUNFIRE fills the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160 arr and Carnby lay Cheung and Marko's bodies to one side the Chamber, their faces covered with their vests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke paces back and forth, screaming into his comm-link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles! Re-route those `copters! Pull all agents back into the mine! Set formation in teams of three! Miles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all that he can hear through the comm-link is GUNFIRE the occasional SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby approaches Burke carefully. Burke looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke signals to Barr. They sweep through the Sand Chambe exploring it with their lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby approaches Aline. She is standing over one of the worm corpses. Its head has been blown off, but its torso intact. Carnby turns the sand worm's body over with his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like the organism Fischer took out of Pinkerton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is what they look like when they grow outside a human host?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke stops at a dark recess carved into the Sand Chamber The recess is thick with cobwebs and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke cleans the cobwebs away. He stops, surprised at wha sees in the recess behind the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better see this.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: gents Miles, Agent Feenstra, and two other AGENTS, are barricaded behind pieces of mining machinery. They SHOOT streams of glowing bullets across the dark Entrance Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, an invisible creature grabs the first Agent fro behind a rusty piece of machinery. The creature throws th Agent into the air. He lands heavily, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the Agent can get to his feet, three invisible creatures pounce, tearing him to shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rom behind his position, Miles SHOOTS at the creatures wi glowing bullets, scattering them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second Agent stands behind a piece of machinery, tens rifle ready. She hears a WHOOSH of movement nearby. She turns, but can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a SHUFFLING sound above her. She looks up. The creature is above her, on top of the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent tries to SHOOT, but the creature's tail SNAPS a her, impaling her with its tail-spike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles and Agent Feenstra SHOOT at the creature with precise BURSTS of glowing bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature leaps at them. Miles and Feenstra hold their positions, RIDDLING the creature with glowing bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A creature leaps out at Feenstra. She hears the WHOOSH of movement at the last moment and swivels, FIRING in the direction of the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut she's SLAMMED off her feet. Feenstra gets a deep GASH her thigh from the creature's spiked tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feenstra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature pounces. But Feenstra is fast enough. She BL AWAY the creature with a BURST of glowing bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 Aline, Carnby, Burke, and Barr stand in front of the dark recess in the Sand Chamber. The recess is completely seal up by a solid concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: line comes up to the concrete wall, running her hands alo its flat surface. It is obviously not Abkani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abkani didn't put this here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Barr shines his light across the concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always a way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke opens his pack. Inside it are several packages of C explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles and Agent Feenstra are barricaded behind an o mining vehicle. The bodies of dead Agents lie around them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Feenstra bleeds from the wound in her thigh. The li on their rifles are the only lights in the Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An invisible creature jumps out at them, knocking debris of the way as it charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles rolls away at the last second as the creature SLAMS into the old mining vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Feenstra spins around and EMPTIES her last clip int the creature, killing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles throws Feenstra a magazine. Feenstra loads it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles tries to get a signal on his comm-link. But it just gives out STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander? Krash? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles pulls off his comm-link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk. If I lay down suppressing fire, maybe you can make it out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I die fighting or I don't die at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles OPENS FIRE into the night. His bullets glow a they streak through the air. Feenstra picks herself up an OPENS FIRE alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creatures SQUEAL in the distance as the bullets find thei marks. Feenstra empties out her last magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An invisible creature leaps over the barricade and pounce Feenstra, tearing into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles SHOOTS at the creature, emptying his last magazine. he's too late to save Feenstra. Her torn-up body slumps against their barricade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Miles is alone. He is out of ammunition. He pulls t trigger futilely. Miles stands firm. He flips up his viso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles closes his eyes. He is hoisted into the air by an invisible creature and thrown to the ground. Invisible creatures tear him apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 Carnby, Aline, Barr, and Burke take cover behind the ston column. Burke holds a remote detonator. It is active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke tries to get a signal on his comm-link. But all he is STATIC. Looking grim, Burke prepares to press the butt on the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is going to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke shrugs and presses the button. The detonator counts down: 3... 2... 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tremendous EXPLOSION rocks the Sand Chamber. Sand whirl through the air. Concrete fragments blow out from the rec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the smoke clears, Carnby, Aline, Burke, and Barr appro the recess. The concrete wall has been blown open. Smoke rises up off the ruined wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sand Chamber now opens up into another dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 Carnby, Aline, Barr, and Burke step over the rubble of th concrete wall. They shine their lights around the dark ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in a large abandoned Bureau 713 Lab. Thick dust covers all surfaces. But it was once a high-tech facility

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one side of the Lab is a sliding metal door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical equipment, scientific instruments, and computers been left as they were, untouched for two decades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of glass tubes are lined up along one wall. In e tube, a spinal-worm lies dead, floating in gelatinous liq

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline checks out a series of diagrams affixed to another wall. They are anatomical schematics for the spinal-worms There are also diagrams of the human body with markings isolating key areas of the spinal cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby stands in front of a row of twenty clear glass bas each about the size of a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each basin has a small metal tag on it. Carnby wipes the layer of dust off one of the metal tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tag reads: E. CARNBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline steps up next to Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke and Barr continue to explore the room with their ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mounted lamps. Barr finds a pair of huge metal hangar doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby, Burke, and Aline approach Barr at the hangar door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the hangar doors is a control panel. Barr pulls t front off the control panel, revealing a rusted hand-cran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barr pulls on the hand-crank. It won't give. Carnby joins and, together, they strain to move the hand-crank. The ha crank CLANKS into the open position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old mechanism is engaged. The hangar doors slide open, revealing another doorway behind them. But this one is clearly not part of the Lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an ancient, solid gold door, carved with Abkani symbols. The gold door is built into a wall of rough rock looks like the Lab was built right around the gold door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the door is a small cylindrical opening.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: line uses her flashlight to read the symbols on the door. One symbol is prominent among the others: the DARK SPIRIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline reaches into her pack and takes out the Abkani devi It is the exact size of the cylindrical opening in the do The same DARK SPIRIT pictogram is engraved on the lynchpi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke surveys the room with a grim expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we got two options. One, we open this door, deal with whatever's on the                    other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictograms carved here make it pretty clear that's a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, we set enough C-4 to bury this                       place. Keep whatever's in there, down                     here for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby stares at the gold door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answers I've been looking for my whole life could be in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some doors are locked for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks away from the gold door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barr... how much C-4 you got left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barr pulls open his pack, revealing several packages of C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to blow this place to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barr is cut off by a bullet hitting him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood spurts out as Barr collapses to the ground, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens stands behind them, carrying two pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't allow that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before they can react, Hudgens presses a pistol to Aline' throat. He points the other pistol at Burke and Carnby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now drop your weapons and back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Burke drop their guns and step back. Carnby gl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at Hudgens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was 713.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our early work was crude, I admit. But eventually we perfected the implant process. You were our last failure, Carnby. If you hadn't escaped, 713 never would've shut down the experiments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke's eyes flash with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way this was sanctioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before your kind took over, 713 had very different... priorities. Now, you just blaze in and destroy everything before we can learn to control it. I've wasted twenty years working in secret because of short-sighted men like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens sees the Abkani device Aline is holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline's expression is firm, unafraid. She grips the devic tightly. Hudgens is about to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a fine archeologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens turns to Carnby, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the key. Enough people have died today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline sees Carnby is serious. She holds out the device to Hudgens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have opened it anyway. Not without this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens takes out the hollow cylinder artifact he found o the Erebus. He hands it to Aline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline inserts the artifact into the hollow circular space the bottom of the device, turning it into place. The devi is now a full cylinder with a flat protrusion on the bott

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one pistol pointed at Burke and Carnby and the other Aline, Hudgens directs her to the gold door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insert the key.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: line inserts the device into the opening in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now turn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline rotates the device, using the flat protrusion on th bottom. It CLICKS into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crack splinters away from the opening where the device sits. The crack splits off into several other crac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens points his pistols at the others, but his attenti is clearly directed at the gold door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we found the first of them, 713 saw                 just another threat to be eliminated. But I knew it was something more. It was the                 first. The first to wake. I've woken                     others since then. But the rest are coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hudgens speaks, Carnby, Burke, and Aline exchange a lo between them. Carnby's eyes indicate the C-4 in Agent Bar pack. Burke and Aline understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cracks splinter out, dividing, until they cover the entire door. In a rush of fragments, the cracked gold crumbles to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he empty doorway now leads into darkness on the other sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens steps through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorway opens up into a vast Cave, hundreds of feet h and wide, stretching off into darkness. The cave walls ar rough-hewn rock, untouched by human hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls of the Cave are marked with hundreds and hundre of tunnels, pocking the rock like a hive, leading off int the depths of the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens moves into the Cave, tentative, but excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's a SCRATCHING, SCURRYING sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A xenomorph creature emerges out of one of the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of another tunnel comes a second xenomorph. And a thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the vast cave, dozens of xenomorphs creep out of individual tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudgens steps further into the Cave. The xenomorphs appro him, their heads darting about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The xenomorphs surround Hudgens on all sides. His steps a careful. He reaches his hand out to one of the creatures.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he creature moves up to Hudgens' hand, smelling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature lunges at him, ripping into him with its tee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other xenomorphs surrounding Hudgens pounce on him as well. The creatures tear Hudgens apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a dam breaking, hundreds of xenomorphs start streami out of the hive-like tunnel system of the Cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway, Aline sees the creatures coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby shoves the hand-crank into the closed position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangar doors in front of the Abkani doorway start to close. Aline backs away from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline OPENS FIRE with an assault rifle. The glowing bulle streak into the dark Cave, hitting several of the approac creatures. But there are too many of them. They keep comi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangar doors are almost closed. The xenomorphs are on few feet from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangar doors SLAM closed just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy impact THUMPS against the other side of the hanga doors. Then another. The xenomorphs are trying to get tho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke is positioning C-4 charges around the Lab. He wires them all through a remote detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These doors won't hold them for long

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we get out, we can remote detonate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby approaches the sliding metal door at the side of t Lab. The dust around the door has been swept back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the dust on the floor. This is where Hudgens got in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby engages the opening mechanism and the door slides open, revealing a dark Tunnel leading away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke makes sure the remote detonator signal is active. A he has to do is press the button on the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangar doors SHAKE from the impacts of creatures slam into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby, Aline, and Burke run down the long, dark Tunnel, lighting their way with flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few doors line the Tunnel, but they are all welded shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby spots a dim light up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tunnel ends at the rungs of a metal ladder built righ into the wall. Aline shines her flashlight up it. A strip light is visible way up high, at the top of a long Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline climbs up the ladder. Carnby climbs up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke shines his lamp down the dark Tunnel. The CRASHING sound of impacts against the doors echo down the Tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke looks at the remote detonator in his hand. The sign is inactive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 176 Aline climbs up the rungs of the ladder built into the Sh wall. Carnby climbs up after her.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: urke stands at the bottom of the Shaft, looking up at the Carnby stops climbing and looks down at Burke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remote detonator's inactive. The signal can't get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life, Carnby. I don't much like debts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke ducks back out of the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby jumps down to the bottom of the Shaft, chasing aft Burke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke runs up to the sliding door to the Lab. He engages opening mechanism. The door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby races down the Tunnel towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke enters the Lab. He closes the sliding door behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby gets to the sliding door just as it's closing. He tries to engage the opening mechanism, but it won't work. Carnby tries to pull it open, but the door's jammed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: line runs up to Carnby as he tries to pry open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward... if he detonates those charges, we're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks torn. Aline reaches out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby takes Aline's hand. They run towards the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke's rifle is jammed into the opening mechanism of the sliding door, blocking it from engaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hangar doors are warped from the impacts. The gap bet the doors is being pulled open by dozens of creatures. Th hangar doors start to buckle under the pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he remote detonator in Burke's hand is now active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline quickly climb up the ladder. They are al at the top of the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shaft is sealed with a pair of corrugated metal doors Sunlight shines through the thin crack between the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby points his gun at the metal doors above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181 A small Storm Cellar is built into a corner of the Orphanage's front lawn. The corrugated metal doors are lo from the outside with a chain and rusty padlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURST of GUNFIRE blows out from inside the Storm Cellar breaking open the padlock. The doors are thrown open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he sun rises on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke looks around the abandoned 713 lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures are almost through the hangar doors. The ga just wide enough for one creature to stick its head throu It SNAPS its jaws at Burke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke presses the button on the detonator. The detonator counts down: 3... 2... 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tremendous EXPLOSION rocks the Shaft. A swirling geyser flame shoots up towards the top of the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline dive out of the Shaft just in time. The geyser of flame erupts out of the Storm Cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock-wave knocks them to the ground. A cloud of dust swirls up out of the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mine shakes from the explosion. Great clouds of dust rock fragments billow out of the Entrance Hall.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he whole mountain RUMBLES from the detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline and Carnby get to their feet outside the Storm Cell Smoke pours out of the Shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he sees where he really is, Carnby is stunned. He stares up at the Orphanage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were under us the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline walk through the Orphanage. It is clean, well-maintained. But no one is there. The Orphanage is em

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are all the children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the Children's Room is ajar. Carnby opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline stand at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Clara lies dead on one of the children's beds. The blankets and sheets are soaked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody gash has been sliced up each of Sister Clara's a A blood-stained straight-razor sits on the bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crumpled piece of paper is clutched in one of Sister Clara's hands. Carnby takes the paper and uncrumples it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The notes reads: "FORGIVE ME, EDWARD."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline and Carnby step out of the Orphanage. Carnby looks around, troubled. No one is visible outside the Orphanage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's very wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 184 Carnby and Aline walk along a deserted street. The sun ri above them. It's a beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shops look ready to open. Cars are parked along the stree But no one is driving. The neighborhood is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby and Aline walk down a wide street in the middle of city's downtown core. No one is visible anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward... what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby looks ashen. They stand in the middle of a downtow intersection, empty streets stretching out in all directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what Hudgens said? I was his last failure. He said he perfected the implant process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where the hell is everybody? Where's everybody gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look down at Carnby and Aline, alone in the intersecti empty streets all around them. We start to float up above them, getting a wider and wider bird's eye view of the ci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swoop up higher above them, but still, no one is visib anywhere in the city. We float up until the entire city stretches out below us. Nothing moves. No one can be seen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I know. There are two worlds on this planet. A world of light and a world of darkness. For millions of years, these worlds were in balance. But now, the lights of human civilization burn everywhere. The dark places are disappearing. We forced them to come out of the shadows. Now, it's my job to force them back in. My name is Edward Carnby. I'm here to protect you from things you don't believe in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start to drop back down, faster and faster, the ground rushing towards us. We are descending directly above Carn and Aline, standing alone in the empty intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swoop down right in front of Carnby. His trench-coat b in the wind. Aline stands next to him, ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnby reloads his revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Edward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a busy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines down above them, illuminating the deserted city streets. Carnby's expression is determined.
